Superseded by #2393.
Superseded by #2399.

Pass-through execution will also ignore any events that are potentially involved with action execution or property change.

Using pass-through for some use cases to speed up things, does make sense to me (e.g. serialization). However, as far as I am concerned, there is that open question regarding the bypassing of events.

We have our own fork of this module, and so this was the correct solution for us.  It certainly shouldn't be `InteractionInitiatedBy.USER`, our reasoning was that `PASSTHROUGH` (rather than `FRAMEWORK`) was the best fit because in a sense we are unmarshalling a spreadsheet into domain objects.

For me `PASSTHROUGH` seems the safest option and not very controversial.  I suppose if we can't decide then we could provide a config option to specify which, but I think that's unnecessary complexity.

In other words 'when to allow bypassing of change events' is an open research question, which I must admit, I had not yet taken my time to investigate in more detail. For reference, this is also related to https://github.com/apache/causeway/pull/2020.
Thanks Dan. I guess you are confirming what I had suspected. Unmarshalling / de-serialization should be a perfect fit with `PASSTHROUGH` execution.
It is OK to bypass change events for unmarshalling! See discussion https://github.com/apache/causeway/pull/2403
I tested this by building causeway-app-simpleapp jdo-SNAPSHOT branch with the namespace modified to "simple-module".
Have you considered using `AsciiIdentifierService` SPI instead?

Hi @andi-huber  - I think that `AsciiIdentifierService` is only called to clean up the memberIds, but not the type names.

![image](https://github.com/apache/causeway/assets/1031625/5183daf2-15fd-4c6b-9b03-301fa021f742)

Given we already have this sanitization, and the code being changed is specific to the graphql viewer only, then I'm happy to have this change here.

@bkalbfus  - could you add an integration test and optionally a unit test to verify that this new code works correctly?

For example, you could take a copy of the CalculatorService and give it a namespace that requires sanitization?
Tests?
@opencirclesolutions-wove  - hm, I guess this PR is redundant because the other one includes all the changes here??
superceded by pr 2412, I believe.

I would gladly!

Superseded by #2414.

I checked what would happen to the tests if I changed the name of the test domain object, `org.apache.causeway.viewer.graphql.viewer.test.domain.i18n.I18nCalculator`, to `university.calc.I18nCälculator`.  A bunch of tests failed, so it looks like this sanitization is justified.  Or, more calls need to be put in to `AsciiIdentifierService`.

Perhaps my preferred approach would have been to enhance the `AsciiIdentifierService`, in support of sanitizing namespaces. But then I'm also lazy and don't want to do the work. So happy with the current solution as well.

If you change your mind, just re-open this PR and I'll resolve any conflicts on it.

needs testing: most likely breaks time picker (UI)
needs testing: most likely breaks time picker (UI)
@andi-huber  - could you review this?  I couldn't see another way to have Causeway render dates as "dd-MM-yyyy"

Btw. if you are looking for ISO date format like `2024-12-31`, that would be provided by the combination of Locale `nds` (or e.g. `kw-GB`) and `FormatStyle.SHORT`. Which is supported by the framework.

What the requirement is from our users is the same format that they had in v1, namely 24-05-2024.  Can this be done without this PR? I couldn't find a way.

I don't think iso format will be accepted.
I'm going to merge this in but will be happy to revert if there's another way already present to support the requirement.

breaks temporal picking - due to momentjs upgrades
we are using our own JS references to an older momentjs, however this update still breaks our pickers

> ResourceReferenceRegistry - A ResourceReference wont be created for a resource with key 
[scope: de.agilecoders.wicket.webjars.request.resource.WebjarsJavaScriptResourceReference; 
name: webjars/moment/2.29.4/min/moment-with-locales.js; locale: null; style: null; variation: null] 
because it cannot be located.
